item.title: A better git log
item.description: I’ve just changed my git log command from the standard: to the more compact and colorful: It’s simple to get this log. Just type in: $ git log --graph --pretty=format:'%Cred%h%Creset -%C(yellow)%d%Creset %s %Cgreen(%cr) %C(bold blue)<%an>%Creset' --abbrev-commit I guess that’s a bit too long, eh? Let’s just make an alias. Copy and paste the line below on your terminal: $ git config --global alias.lg "log --color --graph --pretty=format:'%Cred%h%Creset -%C(yellow)%d%Creset %s %Cgreen(%cr) %C(bold blue)<%an>%Creset' --abbrev-commit" And every time you need to see your log, just type in
